name: Swami Vivekananda
title: The Monk Who Brought Hinduism to the West
description: Swami Vivekananda was a key figure in introducing Indian philosophies to the Western world.
bio: Swami Vivekananda, a disciple of Ramakrishna, is known for his iconic speech at the Parliament of the World's Religions in 1893...

name: Adi Shankaracharya
title: Reviver of Hinduism in India
description: Adi Shankaracharya was a philosopher and theologian who consolidated the doctrine of Advaita Vedanta.
bio: Adi Shankaracharya founded four mathas (monasteries) that played a crucial role in the historical development of Hinduism...

name: Ramakrishna Paramahamsa
title: The Mystic Saint of Bengal
description: Ramakrishna was a mystic and saint who emphasized that all religions lead to the same truth.
bio: Ramakrishna Paramahamsa, known for his deep spiritual insights and mystical experiences, taught that God could be realized through all paths...

name: Sri Aurobindo
title: The Philosopher and Yogi
description: Sri Aurobindo was a philosopher, yogi, and nationalist who founded Integral Yoga.
bio: Sri Aurobindo’s philosophy of Integral Yoga aims at the transformation of human consciousness and establishing a spiritual society...

name: Sant Kabir Das
title: The Poet-Saint of Bhakti Movement
description: Kabir Das was a poet-saint whose verses challenged the orthodoxies of both Hinduism and Islam.
bio: Kabir Das, with his simple yet profound poetry, advocated for a direct relationship with the Divine beyond rituals and dogmas...

name: Guru Nanak Dev
title: The Founder of Sikhism
description: Guru Nanak was a spiritual teacher and the founder of Sikhism, known for his teachings on equality and devotion.
bio: Guru Nanak Dev’s teachings focused on devotion to God, equality, and community service, laying the foundation of Sikhism...

name: Mirabai
title: The Devotee of Lord Krishna
description: Mirabai was a 16th-century poetess and devotee of Lord Krishna, known for her bhakti and devotional songs.
bio: Mirabai, a Rajput princess, abandoned royal life to dedicate herself entirely to Lord Krishna. Her poems and bhajans, filled with love and devotion, continue to inspire millions.

name: Tulsidas
title: Author of the Ramcharitmanas
description: Tulsidas was a poet-saint and the author of the Ramcharitmanas, an epic retelling of the Ramayana in Hindi.
bio: Tulsidas dedicated his life to Lord Rama and composed the Ramcharitmanas, bringing the story of Rama closer to the common people through his inspiring verses.
